author: timbeiko
content: 1. Re: the transaction pool/transition period/conversion from legacy txns, I think this is probably the #1 spec issue now. We should aim to have everyone review it prior to the call next week so we can finally make a decision on it then (and merge in <@!301186049323958275>'s PR if we go for it, or suggest specific changes).

author: timbeiko
content:
2. Re: simulations, I think there are actually 3 things here: economic modelling, "happy path" testnet, and the network congestion. 

For economic modelling, IMO we should aim to get as much done in iPython notebooks as possible, because this means only Barnabe ends up implementing the variations vs. all client teams. If we then have a handful of scenarios we believe need to be tested against more than "just the spec", we can maybe have specific short-lived testnets to test them, or even better, tools to generate that usage pattern on a more public testnet. 

The "happy path" testnet should allow the community to interact with 1559 and ensure all client implementations actually agree with each other. This is like our current PoA testnet, but should hopefully run PoW (to test that code too) and incorporate the latest version of the spec.

author: timbeiko
content: 3. Re: network congestion, I think there's a lot to unpack here:  the DoS risk, block propagation, etc. The issue with DoS risks is their sensitive nature, so they aren't as easily discussable in public. I think a few things that can help here are (1) clients working on general DoS-mitigating solutions (i.e. TurboGeth's flat DB, geth's snapshot sync, Besu's bonsai trie DB approach), (2) EIPs like 2929 and (3) maybe having a more thorough analysis of how DoS risks could happen with 1559.

author: timbeiko
content: For other issues due to "big blocks" I think it'd be good to try and make them more specific. Happy to have 1:1 offline conversations with folks if people don't want to discuss them in a public channel like this one.

author: timbeiko
content: If there's anything else that would gain from synchronous discussion, it'd be great to have a comment about it on the call agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/209
